article.title: Lua API
article.para: To access the darktable specific functions you must load the darktable environment:
All functions and data are accessed through the darktable module.

section.title: darktable
section.para: The darktable library is the main entry point for all access to the darktable internals.

section.title: darktable.print
section.para: Will print a string to the darktable control log (the long overlaid window that appears over the main panel).

listitem.para: The string to display which should be a single line.

section.title: darktable.print_log
section.para: This function will print its parameter if the Lua logdomain is activated. Start darktable with the "-d lua" command line option to enable the Lua logdomain.

listitem.para: The string to display.

section.title: darktable.print_error
section.para: This function is similar todarktable.print_log but adds an ERROR prefix for clarity.

listitem.para: The string to display.

section.title: darktable.register_event
section.para: This function registers a callback to be called when a given event happens.
Events are documented in the event section.

listitem.para: The name of the event to register to.
The function to call on event. The signature of the function depends on the type of event.
Some events need extra parameters at registration time; these must be specified here.

section.title: darktable.register_storage
section.synopsis: function( plugin_name : string, name : string, [store : function], [finalize : function], [supported : function], [initialize : function], [widget : types.lua_widget] )
section.para: This function will add a new storage implemented in Lua.
A storage is a module that is responsible for handling images once they have been generated during export. Examples of core storages include filesystem, e-mail, facebook...

listitem.para: A Unique name for the plugin.
A human readable name for the plugin.

listitem.synopsis: function( storage : types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t, image : types.dt_lua_image_t, format : types.dt_imageio_module_format_t, filename : string, number : integer, total : integer, high_quality : boolean, extra_data : table )
listitem.para: This function is called once for each exported image. Images can be exported in parallel but the calls to this function will be serialized.
The storage object used for the export.
The exported image object.
The format object used for the export.
The name of a temporary file where the processed image is stored.
The number of the image out of the export series.
The total number of images in the export series.
True if the export is high quality.
An empty Lua table to take extra data. This table is common to the initialize, store and finalize calls in an export series.
This function is called once all images are processed and all store calls are finished.
The storage object used for the export.
A table keyed by the exported image objects and valued with the corresponding temporary export filename.
An empty Lua table to store extra data. This table is common to all calls to store and the call to finalize in a given export series.
A function called to check if a given image format is supported by the Lua storage; this is used to build the dropdown format list for the GUI.
Note that the parameters in the format are the ones currently set in the GUI; the user might change them before export.
The storage object tested.
The format object to report about.
True if the corresponding format is supported.

listitem.synopsis: function( storage : types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t, format : types.dt_imageio_module_format_t, images : table of types.dt_lua_image_t, high_quality : boolean, extra_data : table ) : table or nil
listitem.para: A function called before storage happens
This function can change the list of exported functions
The storage object tested.
The format object to report about.
A table containing images to be exported.
True if the export is high quality.
An empty Lua table to take extra data. This table is common to the initialize, store and finalize calls in an export series.
The modified table of images to export or nil
If nil (or nothing) is returned, the original list of images will be exported
If a table of images is returned, that table will be used instead. The table can be empty. The images parameter can be modified and returned
A widget to display in the export section of darktable's UI

section.title: darktable.register_lib
section.synopsis: function( plugin_name : string, name : string, expandable : boolean, resetable : boolean, containers : table of types.dt_lua_view_t => [ types.dt_ui_container_t, int ], widget : types.lua_widget, view_enter : function, view_leave : function )
section.para: Register a new lib object. A lib is a graphical element of darktable's user interface

listitem.para: A unique name for your library
A user-visible name for your library
whether this lib should be expandable or not
whether this lib has a reset button or not
A table associating to each view containing the lib the corresponding container and position
The widget to display in the lib
A callback called when a view displaying the lib is entered
The lib on which the callback is called
The view that we are leaving
The view that we are entering
A callback called when leaving a view displaying the lib
The lib on which the callback is called
The view that we are leaving
The view that we are entering

section.title: darktable.films
section.para: A table containing all the film objects in the database.

section.title: darktable.films.#
section.para: Each film has a numeric entry in the database.

section.title: darktable.films.new
section.para: Creates a new empty film
see darktable.database.import to import a directory with all its images and to add images to a film

listitem.para: The directory that the new film will represent. The directory must exist
The newly created film, or the existing film if the directory is already imported

section.title: darktable.films.delete
section.para: see types.dt_lua_film_t.delete

section.title: darktable.new_format
section.para: Creates a new format object to export images

listitem.para:
The type of format object to create, one of :
copy
exr
j2k
jpeg
pdf
pfm
png
ppm
tiff
webp
The newly created object. Exact type depends on the type passed

section.title: darktable.new_storage
section.para: Creates a new storage object to export images

listitem.para:
The type of storage object to create, one of :
disk
email
facebook
flickr
gallery
latex
picasa
(Other, lua-defined, storage types may appear.)
The newly created object. Exact type depends on the type passed

section.title: darktable.new_widget
section.para: Creates a new widget object to display in the UI

listitem.para:
The type of storage object to create, one of :
box
button
check_button
combobox
container
entry
file_chooser_button
label
section_label
separator
slider
stack
text_view
Extra parameters, exact value are documented with each type
The newly created object. Exact type depends on the type passed

section.title: darktable.gui
section.para: This subtable contains function and data to manipulate the darktable user interface with Lua.
Most of these function won't do anything if the GUI is not enabled (i.e you are using the command line version darktable-cli instead of darktable).

section.title: darktable.gui.action_images
section.para: A table of types.dt_lua_image_t on which the user expects UI actions to happen.
It is based on both the hovered image and the selection and is consistent with the way darktable works.
It is recommended to use this table to implement Lua actions rather than darktable.gui.hovered or darktable.gui.selection to be consistent with darktable's GUI.

section.title: darktable.gui.hovered
section.para: The image under the cursor or nil if no image is hovered.

section.title: darktable.gui.selection
section.para: Allows to change the set of selected images.

listitem.para: A table of images which will define the selected images. If this parameter is not given the selection will be untouched. If an empty table is given the selection will be emptied.
A table containing the selection as it was before the function was called.

section.title: darktable.gui.current_view
section.para: Allows to change the current view.

listitem.para: The view to switch to. If empty the current view is unchanged
the current view

section.title: darktable.gui.create_job
section.para: Create a new progress_bar displayed in darktable.gui.libs.backgroundjobs

listitem.para: The text to display in the job entry
Should a progress bar be displayed
A function called when the cancel button for that job is pressed
note that the job won't be destroyed automatically. You need to set types.dt_lua_backgroundjob_t.valid to false for that
The job who is being cancelled
The newly created job object

section.title: darktable.gui.views
section.para: The different views in darktable

section.title: darktable.gui.views.map
section.para: The map view

section.title: darktable.gui.views.map.latitude
section.para: The latitude of the center of the map

section.title: darktable.gui.views.map.longitude
section.para: The longitude of the center of the map

section.title: darktable.gui.views.map.zoom
section.para: The current zoom level of the map

section.title: darktable.gui.views.darkroom
section.para: The darkroom view

section.title: darktable.gui.views.lighttable
section.para: The lighttable view

section.title: darktable.gui.views.tethering
section.para: The tethering view

section.title: darktable.gui.views.slideshow
section.para: The slideshow view

section.title: darktable.gui.views.print
section.para: The print view

section.title: darktable.gui.libs
section.para: This table allows to reference all lib objects
lib are the graphical blocks within each view.
To quickly figure out what lib is what, you can use the following code which will make a given lib blink.

para.programlisting: local tested_module="global_toolbox" dt.gui.libs[tested_module].visible=false coroutine.yield("WAIT_MS",2000) while true do dt.gui.libs[tested_module].visible = not dt.gui.libs[tested_module].visible coroutine.yield("WAIT_MS",2000) end

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.snapshots
section.para: The UI element that manipulates snapshots in darkroom

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.snapshots.ratio
section.para: The place in the screen where the line separating the snapshot is. Between 0 and 1

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.snapshots.direction
section.para: The direction of the snapshot overlay

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.snapshots.#
section.para: The different snapshots for the image

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.snapshots.selected
section.para: The currently selected snapshot

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.snapshots.take_snapshot
section.para: Take a snapshot of the current image and add it to the UI
The snapshot file will be generated at the next redraw of the main window

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.snapshots.max_snapshot
section.para: The maximum number of snapshots

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.collect
section.para: The collection UI element that allows to filter images by collection

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.collect.filter
section.para: Allows to get or change the list of visible images

listitem.para: A table of rules describing the filter. These rules will be applied after this call
The rules that were applied before this call.

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.collect.new_rule
section.para: Returns a newly created rule object

listitem.para: The newly created rule

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.import
section.para: The buttons to start importing images

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.import.register_widget
section.para: Add a widget in the option expander of the import dialog

listitem.para: The widget to add to the dialog. The reset callback of the widget will be called whenever the dialog is opened

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.styles
section.para: The style selection menu

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.metadata_view
section.para: The widget displaying metadata about the current image

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.metadata_view.register_info
section.para: Register a function providing extra info to display in the widget

listitem.para: The name displayed for the new information
The function providing the info
The image to analyze
The extra information to display

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.metadata
section.para: The widget allowing modification of metadata fields on the current image

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.hinter
section.para: The small line of text at the top of the UI showing the number of selected images

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.modulelist
section.para: The window allowing to set modules as visible/hidden/favorite

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.filmstrip
section.para: The filmstrip at the bottom of some views

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.viewswitcher
section.para: The labels allowing to switch view

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.darktable_label
section.para: The darktable logo in the upper left corner

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.tagging
section.para: The tag manipulation UI

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.geotagging
section.para: The geotagging time synchronisation UI

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.recentcollect
section.para: The recent collection UI element

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.global_toolbox
section.para: The common tools to all view (settings, grouping...)

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.global_toolbox.grouping
section.para: The current status of the image grouping option

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.global_toolbox.show_overlays
section.para: the current status of the image overlays option

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.filter
section.para: The image-filter menus at the top of the UI

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.ratings
section.para: The starts to set the rating of an image

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.select
section.para: The buttons that allow to quickly change the selection

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.select.register_selection
section.para: Add a new button and call a callback when it is clicked

listitem.para: The label to display on the button
The function to call when the button is pressed
The name of the button that was pressed
The images in the current collection. This is the same content asdarktable.collection
The images to set the selection to
The tooltip to use on the new button

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.colorlabels
section.para: The color buttons that allow to set labels on an image

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.lighttable_mode
section.para: The navigation and zoom level UI in lighttable

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.copy_history
section.para: The UI element that manipulates history

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.image
section.para: The UI element that manipulates the current images

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.image.register_action
section.para: Add a new button and call a callback when it is clicked

listitem.para: The label to display on the button
The function to call when the button is pressed
The name of the button that was pressed
The images to act on when the button was clicked
The tooltip to use on the new button

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.modulegroups
section.para: The icons describing the different iop groups

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.module_toolbox
section.para: The tools on the bottom line of the UI (overexposure)

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.session
section.para: The session UI when tethering

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.histogram
section.para: The histogram widget

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.export
section.para: The export menu

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.history
section.para: The history manipulation menu

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.colorpicker
section.para: The colorpicker menu

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.navigation
section.para: The full image preview to allow navigation

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.masks
section.para: The masks window

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.live_view
section.para: The liveview window

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.map_settings
section.para: The map setting window

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.camera
section.para: The camera selection UI

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.location
section.para: The location ui

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.backgroundjobs
section.para: The window displaying the currently running jobs

section.title: darktable.gui.libs.print_settings
section.para: The settings window in the print view

section.title: darktable.guides
section.para: Guide lines to overlay over an image in crop and rotate.
All guides are clipped to the drawing area.

section.title: darktable.guides.register_guide
section.para: Register a new guide.

listitem.para: The name of the guide to show in the GUI.

listitem.synopsis: function( cr : types.dt_lua_cairo_t, x : float, y : float, width : float, height : float, zoom_scale : float )
listitem.para: The function to call to draw the guide lines. The drawn lines will be stroked by darktable.
THIS IS RUNNING IN THE GUI THREAD AND HAS TO BE FAST!
The cairo object used for drawing.
The x coordinate of the top left corner of the drawing area.
The y coordinate of the top left corner of the drawing area.
The width of the drawing area.
The height of the drawing area.
The current zoom_scale. Only needed when setting the line thickness.
A function returning a widget to show when the guide is selected. It takes no arguments.

section.title: darktable.tags
section.para: Allows access to all existing tags.

section.title: darktable.tags.#
section.para: Each existing tag has a numeric entry in the tags table - use ipairs to iterate over them.

section.title: darktable.tags.create
section.para: Creates a new tag and return it. If the tag exists return the existing tag.

listitem.para: The name of the new tag.

section.title: darktable.tags.find
section.para: Returns the tag object or nil if the tag doesn't exist.

listitem.para: The name of the tag to find.
The tag object or nil.

section.title: darktable.tags.delete
section.para: Deletes the tag object, detaching it from all images.

listitem.para: The tag to be deleted.

section.title: darktable.tags.attach
section.para: Attach a tag to an image; the order of the parameters can be reversed.

listitem.para: The tag to be attached.
The image to attach the tag to.

section.title: darktable.tags.detach
section.para: Detach a tag from an image; the order of the parameters can be reversed.

listitem.para: The tag to be detached.
The image to detach the tag from.

section.title: darktable.tags.get_tags
section.para: Gets all tags attached to an image.

listitem.para: The image to get the tags from.
A table of tags that are attached to the image.

section.title: darktable.configuration
section.para: This table regroups values that describe details of the configuration of darktable.

section.title: darktable.configuration.version
section.para: The version number of darktable.

section.title: darktable.configuration.has_gui
section.para: True if darktable has a GUI (launched through the main darktable command, not darktable-cli).

section.title: darktable.configuration.verbose
section.para: True if the Lua logdomain is enabled.

section.title: darktable.configuration.tmp_dir
section.para: The name of the directory where darktable will store temporary files.

section.title: darktable.configuration.config_dir
section.para: The name of the directory where darktable will find its global configuration objects (modules).

section.title: darktable.configuration.cache_dir
section.para: The name of the directory where darktable will store its mipmaps.

section.title: darktable.configuration.api_version_major
section.para: The major version number of the lua API.

section.title: darktable.configuration.api_version_minor
section.para: The minor version number of the lua API.

section.title: darktable.configuration.api_version_patch
section.para: The patch version number of the lua API.

section.title: darktable.configuration.api_version_suffix
section.para: The version suffix of the lua API.

section.title: darktable.configuration.api_version_string
section.para: The version description of the lua API. This is a string compatible with the semantic versioning convention

section.title: darktable.configuration.running_os
section.para: The name of the Operating system darktable is currently running on

section.title: darktable.configuration.check_version
section.para: Check that a module is compatible with the running version of darktable
Add the following line at the top of your module :
To document that your module has been tested with API version M.m.p and M2.m2.p2.
This will raise an error if the user is running a released version of DT and a warning if he is running a development version
(the ... here will automatically expand to your module name if used at the top of your script

listitem.para: The name of the module to report on error
Tables of API versions that are known to work with the script

section.title: darktable.preferences
section.para: Lua allows you to manipulate preferences. Lua has its own namespace for preferences and you can't access nor write normal darktable preferences.

Preference handling functions take a _script_ parameter. This is a string used to avoid name collision in preferences (i.e namespace). Set it to something unique, usually the name of the script handling the preference.
Preference handling functions can't guess the type of a parameter. You must pass the type of the preference you are handling.
Note that the directory, enum, lua and file type preferences are stored internally as string. The user can only select valid values, but a lua script can set it to any string

section.title: darktable.preferences.register
section.synopsis: function( script : string, name : string, type : types.lua_pref_type, label : string, tooltip : string, [default : depends on type], [min : int or float], [max : int or float], [step : float], [values : string...], [widget : types.lua_widget], [set_callback : function] )
section.para: Creates a new preference entry in the Lua tab of the preference screen. If this function is not called the preference can't be set by the user (you can still read and write invisible preferences).

listitem.para: Invisible prefix to guarantee unicity of preferences.
A unique name used with the script part to identify the preference.
The type of the preference - one of the string values described above.
The label displayed in the preference screen.
The tooltip to display in the preference menu.
Default value to use when not set explicitly or by the user.
For the enum type of pref, this is mandatory
Minimum value (integer and float preferences only).
Maximum value (integer and float preferences only).
Step of the spinner (float preferences only).
Other allowed values (enum preferences only)
The widget to use in preference(lua preferences only)
A function called when the widget needs to be updated from the preference
The widget to update

section.title: darktable.preferences.read
section.para: Reads a value from a Lua preference.

listitem.para: Invisible prefix to guarantee unicity of preferences.
The name of the preference displayed in the preference screen.
The type of the preference.
The value of the preference.

section.title: darktable.preferences.write
section.para: Writes a value to a Lua preference.

listitem.para: Invisible prefix to guarantee unicity of preferences.
The name of the preference displayed in the preference screen.
The type of the preference.
The value to set the preference to.

section.title: darktable.styles
section.para: This pseudo table allows you to access and manipulate styles.

section.title: darktable.styles.#
section.para: Each existing style has a numeric index; you can iterate them using ipairs.

section.title: darktable.styles.create
section.para: Create a new style based on an image.

listitem.para: The image to create the style from.
The name to give to the new style.
The description of the new style.
The new style object.

section.title: darktable.styles.delete
section.para: Deletes an existing style.

listitem.para: the style to delete

section.title: darktable.styles.duplicate
section.para: Create a new style based on an existing style.

listitem.para: The style to base the new style on.
The new style's name.
The new style's description.
The new style object.

section.title: darktable.styles.apply
section.para: Apply a style to an image. The order of parameters can be inverted.

listitem.para: The style to use.
The image to apply the style to.

section.title: darktable.styles.import
section.para: Import a style from an external .dtstyle file

listitem.para: The file to import

section.title: darktable.styles.export
section.para: Export a style to an external .dtstyle file

listitem.para: The style to export
The directory to export to
Is overwriting an existing file allowed

section.title: darktable.database
section.para: Allows to access the database of images. Note that duplicate images (images with the same RAW but different XMP) will appear multiple times with different duplicate indexes. Also note that all images are here. This table is not influenced by any GUI filtering (collections, stars etc...).

section.title: darktable.database.#
section.para: Each image in the database appears with a numerical index; you can iterate them using ipairs.

section.title: darktable.database.duplicate
section.para: Creates a duplicate of an image and returns it.

listitem.para: the image to duplicate
The new image object.

section.title: darktable.database.import
section.para: Imports new images into the database.

listitem.para:
The filename or directory to import images from.
NOTE: If the images are set to be imported recursively in preferences only the toplevel film is returned (the one whose path was given as a parameter).
NOTE2: If the parameter is a directory the call is non-blocking; the film object will not have the newly imported images yet. Use a post-import-film filtering on that film to react when images are actually imported.
The created image if an image is imported or the toplevel film object if a film was imported.

section.title: darktable.database.move_image
section.para: Physically moves an image (and all its duplicates) to another film.
This will move the image file, the related XMP and all XMP for the duplicates to the directory of the new film
Note that the parameter order is not relevant.

listitem.para: The image to move
The film to move to

section.title: darktable.database.copy_image
section.para: Physically copies an image to another film.
This will copy the image file and the related XMP to the directory of the new film
If there is already a file with the same name as the image file, it will create a duplicate from that file instead
Note that the parameter order is not relevant.

listitem.para: The image to copy
The film to copy to
The new image

section.title: darktable.database.delete
section.para: see types.dt_lua_image_t.delete

section.title: darktable.collection
section.para: Allows to access the currently worked on images, i.e the ones selected by the collection lib. Filtering (rating etc) does not change that collection.

section.title: darktable.collection.#
section.para: Each image in the collection appears with a numerical index; you can iterate them using ipairs.

section.title: darktable.control
section.para: This table contain function to manipulate the control flow of lua programs. It provides ways to do background jobs and other related functions

section.title: darktable.control.ending
section.para: TRUE when darktable is terminating
Use this variable to detect when you should finish long running jobs

section.title: darktable.control.dispatch
section.para: Runs a function in the background. This function will be run at a later point, after luarc has finished running. If you do a loop in such a function, please check darktable.control.ending in your loop to finish the function when DT exits

listitem.para: The call to dispatch
extra parameters to pass to the function

section.title: darktable.control.sleep
section.para: Suspends execution while not blocking darktable

listitem.para: The delay in millisecond to sleep

section.title: darktable.control.execute
section.para: Run a command in a shell while not blocking darktable

listitem.para: The command to run, as in 'sh -c'
The result of the system call

section.title: darktable.control.read
section.para: Block until a file is readable while not blocking darktable

para.emphasis: This function is not available on Windows builds

listitem.para: The file object to wait for

section.title: darktable.gettext
section.para: This table contains functions related to translating lua scripts

section.title: darktable.gettext.gettext
section.para: Translate a string using the darktable textdomain

listitem.para: The string to translate
The translated string

section.title: darktable.gettext.dgettext
section.para: Translate a string using the specified textdomain

listitem.para: The domain to use for that translation
The string to translate
The translated string

section.title: darktable.gettext.ngettext
section.para: Translate a string depending on the number of objects using the darktable textdomain

listitem.para: The string to translate
The string to translate in plural form
The number of objects
The translated string

section.title: darktable.gettext.dngettext
section.para: Translate a string depending on the number of objects using the specified textdomain

listitem.para: The domain to use for that translation
The string to translate
The string to translate in plural form
The number of objects
The translated string

section.title: darktable.gettext.bindtextdomain
section.para: Tell gettext where to find the .mo file translating messages for a particular domain

listitem.para: The domain to use for that translation
The base directory to look for the file. The file should be placed in dirname/locale name/LC_MESSAGES/domain.mo

section.title: darktable.debug
section.para:
This section must be activated separately by calling
require "darktable.debug"

section.title: darktable.debug.dump
section.para:
This will return a string describing everything Lua knows about an object, used to know what an object is.
This function is recursion-safe and can be used to dump _G if needed.

listitem.para: The object to dump.
A name to use for the object.
A table of object,string pairs. Any object in that table will not be dumped, the string will be printed instead.
defaults to darktable.debug.known if not set
A string containing a text description of the object - can be very long.

section.title: darktable.debug.debug
section.para: Initialized to false; set it to true to also dump information about metatables.

section.title: darktable.debug.max_depth
section.para: Initialized to 10; The maximum depth to recursively dump content.

section.title: darktable.debug.known
section.para: A table containing the default value of darktable.debug.dump.known

section.title: darktable.debug.type
section.para: Similar to the system function type() but it will return the real type instead of "userdata" for darktable specific objects.

listitem.para: The object whose type must be reported.
A string describing the type of the object.

section.title: types
section.para: This section documents types that are specific to darktable's Lua API.

section.title: types.lua_os_type
section.para: The type of OS we darktable can run on

listitem.para: windows
macos
linux
unix

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t
section.para:
Image objects represent an image in the database. This is slightly different from a file on disk since a file can have multiple developments.
Note that this is the real image object; changing the value of a field will immediately change it in darktable and will be reflected on any copy of that image object you may have kept.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.attach_tag
section.para: see darktable.tags.attach

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.detach_tag
section.para: see darktable.tags.detach

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.get_tags
section.para: see darktable.tags.get_tags

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.create_style
section.para: see darktable.styles.create

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.apply_style
section.para: see darktable.styles.apply

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.duplicate
section.para: see darktable.database.duplicate

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.move
section.para: see darktable.database.move_image

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.copy
section.para: see darktable.database.copy_image

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.id
section.para: A unique id identifying the image in the database.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.path
section.para: The file the directory containing the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.film
section.para: The film object that contains this image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.filename
section.para: The filename of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.sidecar
section.para: The filename of the image's sidecar file.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.duplicate_index
section.para: If there are multiple images based on a same file, each will have a unique number, starting from 0.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.publisher
section.para: The publisher field of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.title
section.para: The title field of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.creator
section.para: The creator field of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.rights
section.para: The rights field of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.description
section.para: The description field for the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_maker
section.para: The maker exif data.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_model
section.para: The camera model used.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_lens
section.para: The id string of the lens used.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_aperture
section.para: The aperture saved in the exif data.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_exposure
section.para: The exposure time of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_focal_length
section.para: The focal length of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_iso
section.para: The iso used on the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_datetime_taken
section.para: The date and time of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_focus_distance
section.para: The distance of the subject.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_crop
section.para: The exif crop data.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.latitude
section.para: GPS latitude data of the image, nil if not set.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.longitude
section.para: GPS longitude data of the image, nil if not set.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.elevation
section.para: GPS altitude data of the image, nil if not set.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.is_raw
section.para: True if the image is a RAW file.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.is_ldr
section.para: True if the image is a ldr image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.is_hdr
section.para: True if the image is a hdr image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.has_txt
section.para: True if the image has a txt sidecar file.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.width
section.para: The width of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.height
section.para: The height of the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.rating
section.para: The rating of the image (-1 for rejected).

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.red
section.para: True if the image has the corresponding colorlabel.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.blue
section.para: see types.dt_lua_image_t.red

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.green
section.para: see types.dt_lua_image_t.red

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.yellow
section.para: see types.dt_lua_image_t.red

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.purple
section.para: see types.dt_lua_image_t.red

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.reset
section.para: Removes all processing from the image, resetting it back to its original state

listitem.para: The image whose history will be deleted

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.delete
section.para: Removes an image from the database

listitem.para: The image to remove

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.group_with
section.para: Puts the first image in the same group as the second image. If no second image is provided the image will be in its own group.

listitem.para: The image whose group must be changed.
The image we want to group with.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.make_group_leader
section.para: Makes the image the leader of its group.

listitem.para: The image we want as the leader.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.get_group_members
section.para: Returns a table containing all types.dt_lua_image_t of the group. The group leader is both at a numeric key and at the "leader" special key (so you probably want to use ipairs to iterate through that table).

listitem.para: The image whose group we are querying.
A table of image objects containing all images that are in the same group as the image.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.group_leader
section.para: The image which is the leader of the group this image is a member of.

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.local_copy
section.para: True if the image has a copy in the local cache

section.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.drop_cache
section.para: drops the cached version of this image.
This function should be called if an image is modified out of darktable to force DT to regenerate the thumbnail
darktable will regenerate the thumbnail by itself when it is needed

listitem.para: The image whose cache must be dropped.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t
section.para: A virtual type representing all format types.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.plugin_name
section.para: A unique name for the plugin.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.name
section.para: A human readable name for the plugin.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.extension
section.para: The typical filename extension for that format.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.mime
section.para: The mime type associated with the format.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.max_width
section.para: The max width allowed for the format (0 = unlimited).

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.max_height
section.para: The max height allowed for the format (0 = unlimited).

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_t.write_image
section.synopsis: self:function( image : types.dt_lua_image_t, filename : string, [allow_upscale : boolean] ) : boolean
section.para: Exports an image to a file. This is a blocking operation that will not return until the image is exported.

listitem.para: The format that will be used to export.
The image object to export.
The filename to export to.
Set to true to allow upscaling of the image.
Returns true on success.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_png.bpp
section.para: The bpp parameter to use when exporting.

section.para: Type object describing parameters to export to tiff.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_tiff.bpp
section.para: The bpp parameter to use when exporting.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_exr.compression
section.para: The compression parameter to use when exporting.

section.para: Type object describing parameters to export to copy.

section.para: The quality to use at export time.

section.para: Type object describing parameters to export to ppm.

section.para: The overall quality to use; can be one of "webp_lossy" or "webp_lossless".

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_webp.hint
section.para: A hint on the overall content of the image.

section.para: The quality to use at export time.

section.para: The bpp parameter to use when exporting.

section.para: The format to use.

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_j2k.preset
section.para: The preset to use.

section.para: Type object describing parameters to export to pdf.

section.para: The dot per inch value to use at export

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_pdf.icc
section.para: Should the images be tagged with their embedded profile

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_pdf.border
section.para: Empty space around the PDF images

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_pdf.orientation
section.para: Orientation of the pages in the document

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_pdf.title
section.para: The title for the document types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_pdf.rotate:set_text([[Should the images be rotated to match the PDF orientation

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_pdf.mode
section.para: The image mode to use at export time

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_pdf.size
section.para: The paper size to use

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_pdf.compression
section.para: Compression mode to use for images

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_pdf.pages
section.para: The page type to use

section.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_pdf.rotate
section.para: Should the images be rotated in the resulting PDF

section.para: see darktable.database.copy_image

section.title: types.dt_lua_film_t.#
section.para: The different images within the film.

section.title: types.dt_lua_film_t.id
section.para: A unique numeric id used by this film.

section.title: types.dt_lua_film_t.path
section.para: The path represented by this film.

section.title: types.dt_lua_film_t.delete

Force removal, even if the film is not empty.

section.title: types.dt_lua_lib_t
section.para: The type of a UI lib

section.title: types.dt_lua_lib_t.id
section.para: A unit string identifying the lib

section.title: types.dt_lua_lib_t.name
section.para: The translated title of the UI element

section.title: types.dt_lua_lib_t.version
section.para: The version of the internal data of this lib

section.title: types.dt_lua_lib_t.visible
section.para: Allow to make a lib module completely invisible to the user.
Note that if the module is invisible the user will have no way to restore it without lua

section.title: types.dt_lua_lib_t.container
section.para: The location of the lib in the darktable UI

section.title: types.dt_lua_lib_t.expandable
section.para: True if the lib can be expanded/retracted

section.title: types.dt_lua_lib_t.expanded
section.para: True if the lib is expanded

section.title: types.dt_lua_lib_t.position
section.para: A value deciding the position of the lib within its container

section.title: types.dt_lua_lib_t.views
section.para: A table of all the views that display this widget

section.title: types.dt_lua_lib_t.reset
section.para: A function to reset the lib to its default values
This function will do nothing if the lib is not visible or can't be reset

listitem.para: The lib to reset

section.title: types.dt_lua_lib_t.on_screen
section.para: True if the lib is currently visible on the screen

section.title: types.dt_lua_view_t
section.para: A darktable view

section.title: types.dt_lua_view_t.id
section.para: A unique string identifying the view

section.title: types.dt_lua_view_t.name
section.para: The name of the view

section.title: types.dt_lua_backgroundjob_t
section.para: A lua-managed entry in the backgroundjob lib

section.title: types.dt_lua_backgroundjob_t.percent
section.para: The value of the progress bar, between 0 and 1. will return nil if there is no progress bar, will raise an error if read or written on an invalid job

section.title: types.dt_lua_backgroundjob_t.valid
section.para: True if the job is displayed, set it to false to destroy the entry
An invalid job cannot be made valid again

section.title: types.dt_lua_snapshot_t
section.para: The description of a snapshot in the snapshot lib

section.title: types.dt_lua_snapshot_t.filename
section.para: The filename of an image containing the snapshot

section.para: Activates this snapshot on the display. To deactivate all snapshot you need to call this function on the active snapshot

listitem.para: The snapshot to activate

section.title: types.dt_lua_snapshot_t.name
section.para: The name of the snapshot, as seen in the UI

section.title: types.dt_lua_cairo_t
section.para: A wrapper around a cairo drawing context.
You probably shouldn't use this after the callback that got it passed returned.
For more details of the member functions have a look at the cairo documentation for the drawing context, transformations and paths.

section.title: types.dt_lua_cairo_t.save
section.para: Save the state of the drawing context.

listitem.para: The context to modify.

section.title: types.dt_lua_cairo_t.restore
section.para: Restore a previously saved state.

listitem.para: The context to modify.

section.title: types.dt_lua_cairo_t.move_to
section.para: Begin a new sub-path.

listitem.para: The context to modify
The x coordinate of the new position.
The y coordinate of the new position.

section.title: types.dt_lua_cairo_t.line_to
section.para: Add a line to the path.

listitem.para: The context to modify.
The x coordinate of the end of the new line.
The y coordinate of the end of the new line.

section.title: types.dt_lua_cairo_t.rectangle
section.synopsis: self:function( x : float, y : float, width : float, height : float )
section.para: Add a closed sub-path rectangle.

listitem.para: The context to modify.
The x coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
The y coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
The width of the rectangle.
The height of the rectangle.

section.title: types.dt_lua_cairo_t.arc
section.synopsis: self:function( x : float, y : float, radius : float, angle1 : float, angle2 : float )
section.para: Add a circular arc.

listitem.para: The context to modify.
The x position of the center of the arc.
The y position of the center of the arc.
The radius of the arc.
The start angle, in radians.
The end angle, in radians.

section.title: types.dt_lua_cairo_t.arc_negative
section.synopsis: self:function( x : float, y : float, radius : float, angle1 : float, angle2 : float )
section.para: Add a circular arc. It only differs in the direction from types.dt_lua_cairo_t.arc.

listitem.para: The context to modify.
The x position of the center of the arc.
The y position of the center of the arc.
The radius of the arc.
The start angle, in radians.
The end angle, in radians.

section.title: types.dt_lua_cairo_t.rotate
section.para: Add a rotation to the transformation matrix.

listitem.para: The context to modify.
The angle (in radians) by which the user-space axes will be rotated.

section.title: types.dt_lua_cairo_t.scale
section.para: Add a scaling to the transformation matrix.

listitem.para: The context to modify.
The scale factor for the x dimension.
The scale factor for the y dimension.

section.title: types.dt_lua_cairo_t.translate
section.para: Add a translation to the transformation matrix.

listitem.para: The context to modify.
Amount to translate in the x direction
Amount to translate in the y direction

section.title: types.dt_lua_cairo_t.new_sub_path
section.para: Begin a new sub-path.

listitem.para: The context to modify.

section.title: types.dt_lua_cairo_t.draw_line
section.synopsis: self:function( x_start : float, y_start : float, x_end : float, y_end : float )
section.para: Helper function to draw a line with a given start and end.

listitem.para: The context to modify.
The x coordinate of the start of the new line.
The y coordinate of the start of the new line.
The x coordinate of the end of the new line.
The y coordinate of the end of the new line.

section.title: types.lua_widget
section.para: Common parent type for all lua-handled widgets

section.title: types.lua_widget.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_widget.sensitive
section.para: Set if the widget is enabled/disabled

section.title: types.lua_widget.tooltip
section.para: Tooltip to display for the widget

section.title: types.lua_widget.reset_callback
section.para: A function to call when the widget needs to reset itself

Note that some widgets have a default implementation that can be overridden, (containers in particular will recursively reset their children). If you replace that default implementation you need to reimplement that functionality or call the original function within your callback

listitem.para: The widget that triggered the callback

section.title: types.lua_widget.As a function
section.para: Using a lua widget as a function Allows to set multiple attributes of that widget at once. This is mainly used to create UI elements in a more readable way
For example:

listitem.para: A table of attributes => value to set
The object called itself, to allow chaining

section.title: types.lua_container
section.para: A widget containing other widgets

section.title: types.lua_container.__call
section.para: see types.lua_widget.As a function

section.title: types.lua_container.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_container.#
section.para: The widgets contained by the box
You can append widgets by adding them at the end of the list
You can remove widgets by setting them to nil

section.title: types.lua_check_button
section.para: A checkable button with a label next to it

section.title: types.lua_check_button.__call
section.para: see types.lua_widget.As a function

section.title: types.lua_check_button.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_check_button.label
section.para: The label displayed next to the button

section.title: types.lua_check_button.value
section.para: If the widget is checked or not

section.title: types.lua_check_button.clicked_callback
section.para: A function to call on button click

listitem.para: The widget that triggered the callback

section.title: types.lua_label
section.para: A label containing some text

section.title: types.lua_label.__call
section.para: see types.lua_widget.As a function

section.title: types.lua_label.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_label.label
section.para: The label displayed

section.title: types.lua_label.selectable
section.para: True if the label content should be selectable

section.title: types.lua_label.halign
section.para: The horizontal alignment of the label

section.title: types.lua_label.ellipsize
section.para: The ellipsize mode of the label

section.title: types.lua_button
section.para: A clickable button

section.title: types.lua_button.__call
section.para: see types.lua_widget.As a function

section.title: types.lua_button.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_button.label
section.para: The label displayed on the button

section.title: types.lua_button.clicked_callback
section.para: A function to call on button click

listitem.para: The widget that triggered the callback

section.title: types.lua_box
section.para: A container for widget in a horizontal or vertical list

section.title: types.lua_box.__call
section.para: see types.lua_widget.As a function

section.title: types.lua_box.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_box.orientation
section.para: The orientation of the box.

section.title: types.lua_entry
section.para: A widget in which the user can input text

section.title: types.lua_entry.__call
section.para: see types.lua_widget.As a function

section.title: types.lua_entry.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_entry.text
section.para: The content of the entry

section.title: types.lua_entry.placeholder
section.para: The text to display when the entry is empty

section.title: types.lua_entry.is_password
section.para: True if the text content should be hidden

section.title: types.lua_entry.editable
section.para: False if the entry should be read-only

section.title: types.lua_separator
section.para: A widget providing a separation in the UI.

section.title: types.lua_separator.__call
section.para: see types.lua_widget.As a function

section.title: types.lua_separator.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_separator.orientation
section.para: The orientation of the separator.

section.title: types.lua_combobox
section.para: A widget with multiple text entries in a menu
This widget can be set as editable at construction time.
If it is editable the user can type a value and is not constrained by the values in the menu

section.title: types.lua_combobox.__call
section.para: see types.lua_widget.As a function

section.title: types.lua_combobox.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_combobox.value
section.para: The text content of the selected entry, can be nil
You can set it to a number to select the corresponding entry from the menu
If the combo box is editable, you can set it to any string
You can set it to nil to deselect all entries

section.title: types.lua_combobox.selected
section.para: The index of the selected entry, or 0 if nothing is selected
You can set it to a number to select the corresponding entry from the menu, or to 0 to select nothing
You can set it to nil to deselect all entries

section.title: types.lua_combobox.#
section.para: The various menu entries.
You can add new entries by writing to the first element beyond the end
You can removes entries by setting them to nil

section.title: types.lua_combobox.changed_callback
section.para: A function to call when the value field changes (character entered or value selected)

listitem.para: The widget that triggered the callback

section.title: types.lua_combobox.editable
section.para: True is the user is allowed to type a string in the combobox

section.title: types.lua_combobox.label
section.para: The label displayed on the combobox

section.title: types.lua_file_chooser_button
section.para: A button that allows the user to select an existing file

section.title: types.lua_file_chooser_button.__call
section.para: see types.lua_widget.As a function

section.title: types.lua_file_chooser_button.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_file_chooser_button.title
section.para: The title of the window when choosing a file

section.title: types.lua_file_chooser_button.value
section.para: The currently selected file

section.title: types.lua_file_chooser_button.changed_callback
section.para: A function to call when the value field changes (character entered or value selected)

listitem.para: The widget that triggered the callback

section.title: types.lua_file_chooser_button.is_directory
section.para: True if the file chooser button only allows directories to be selected

section.title: types.lua_stack
section.para: A container that will only show one of its child at a time

section.title: types.lua_stack.__call
section.para: see types.lua_widget.As a function

section.title: types.lua_stack.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_stack.active
section.para: The currently selected child, can be nil if the container has no child, can be set to one of the child widget or to an index in the child table

section.title: types.lua_slider
section.para: A slider that can be set by the user

section.title: types.lua_slider.__call
section.para: see types.lua_widget.As a function

section.title: types.lua_slider.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_slider.soft_min
section.para: The soft minimum value for the slider, the slider can't go beyond this point

section.title: types.lua_slider.soft_max
section.para: The soft maximum value for the slider, the slider can't go beyond this point

section.title: types.lua_slider.hard_min
section.para: The hard minimum value for the slider, the user can't manually enter a value beyond this point

section.title: types.lua_slider.hard_max
section.para: The hard maximum value for the slider, the user can't manually enter a value beyond this point

section.title: types.lua_slider.step
section.para: The step width of the slider

section.title: types.lua_slider.digits
section.para: The number of decimal digits shown on the slider

section.title: types.lua_slider.value
section.para: The current value of the slider

section.title: types.lua_slider.label
section.para: The label next to the slider

section.title: types.lua_text_view
section.para: A multiline text input widget

section.title: types.lua_text_view.__call
section.para: see types.lua_widget.As a function

section.title: types.lua_text_view.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_text_view.text
section.para: The text in the widget

section.title: types.lua_text_view.editable
section.para: False if the entry should be read-only

section.title: types.lua_section_label
section.para: A section label

section.title: types.lua_section_label.__call
section.para: see types.lua_widget.As a function

section.title: types.lua_section_label.extra registration parameters
section.para: This widget has no extra registration parameters

section.title: types.lua_section_label.label
section.para: The section name

section.title: events
section.para: This section documents events that can be used to trigger Lua callbacks.

section.title: events.intermediate-export-image
section.para: This event is called each time an image is exported, once for each image after the image has been processed to an image format but before the storage has moved the image to its final destination. The call is blocking.

section.title: events.intermediate-export-image.callback
section.synopsis: function( event : string, image : types.dt_lua_image_t, filename : string, format : types.dt_imageio_module_format_t, storage : types.dt_imageio_module_storage_t )

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The image object that has been exported.
The name of the file that is the result of the image being processed.
The format used to export the image.
The storage used to export the image (can be nil).

section.title: events.intermediate-export-image.extra registration parameters
section.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

section.title: events.post-import-image
section.para:
This event is triggered whenever a new image is imported into the database.
This event can be registered multiple times, all callbacks will be called. The call is blocking.

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The image object that has been imported.

section.title: events.post-import-image.extra registration parameters
section.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

section.title: events.shortcut
section.para:
This event registers a new keyboard shortcut. The shortcut isn't bound to any key until the users does so in the preference panel.
The event is triggered whenever the shortcut is triggered.
This event can only be registered once per value of shortcut.

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The tooltip string that was given at registration time.
The string that will be displayed on the shortcut preference panel describing the shortcut.

section.title: events.post-import-film
section.para: This event is triggered when an film import is finished (all post-import-image callbacks have already been triggered). This event can be registered multiple times.

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The new film that has been added. If multiple films were added recursively only the top level film is reported.

section.title: events.post-import-film.extra registration parameters
section.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

section.title: events.view-changed
section.para: This event is triggered after the user changed the active view

section.title: events.view-changed.callback

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The view that we just left
The view we are now in

section.title: events.view-changed.extra registration parameters
section.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

section.title: events.global_toolbox-grouping_toggle
section.para: This event is triggered after the user toggled the grouping button.

listitem.para: the new grouping status.

section.title: events.global_toolbox-grouping_toggle.extra registration parameters
section.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

section.title: events.global_toolbox-overlay_toggle
section.para: This event is triggered after the user toggled the overlay button.

listitem.para: the new overlay status.

section.title: events.global_toolbox-overlay_toggle.extra registration parameters
section.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

section.title: events.mouse-over-image-changed
section.para: This event is triggered whenever the image under the mouse changes

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The new image under the mouse, can be nil if there is no image under the mouse

section.title: events.mouse-over-image-changed.extra registration parameters
section.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

section.title: events.exit
section.para: This event is triggered when darktable exits, it allows lua scripts to do cleanup jobs

section.title: events.exit.extra registration parameters
section.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

section.title: events.pre-import
section.para: This event is trigger before any import action

section.title: events.pre-import.callback

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The files that will be imported. Modifying this table will change the list of files that will be imported"

section.title: events.pre-import.extra registration parameters
section.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

section.title: attributes
section.para: This section documents various attributes used throughout the documentation.

section.title: attributes.write
section.para: This object is a variable that can be written to.

section.title: attributes.has_tostring
section.para: This object has a specific reimplementation of the "tostring" method that allows pretty-printing it.

section.title: attributes.implicit_yield
section.para: This call will release the Lua lock while executing, thus allowing other Lua callbacks to run.

section.title: attributes.parent
section.para: This object inherits some methods from another object. You can call the methods from the parent on the child object
